page.title: 05WEST FARM
page.content: Near to the{A1}and its junction with the{A19}the farm stretches right up to the urban recreational space on {Hedworth Estate.}The fields are intensively managed in large divisions with boundaries of wooden posts and barbed wire. Some of the remaining hawthorn hedges are 150 years old.{ {Friesian}cows feed on the pasture and fields of grass are grown to provide silage for the winter. The fields are nearly flat with the heavy, black soil of the River Tyne flood plain. A stream called Calf Burn runs through the farm. Most farm buildings are of sandstone with slate roofs, with more modern barns made of asbestos panels. The original farmhouse was demolished and replaced by a two storey brick building.
